ETYMOLOGY: Compound of Middle English sunne (from Old English sunne) and shine (from Old English scīnan 'to shine').

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The direct light and heat from the sun.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: We finally have some sunshine after weeks of rain.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 下了几周的雨之后，我们终于迎来了阳光。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A state of happiness, cheerfulness, or brightness.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 快乐；幸福；开朗的精神状态。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Her presence always brings sunshine into the office.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 她的出现总是给办公室带来阳光（快乐）。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: uncountable noun; used when addressing someone directly
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: An affectionate name used when addressing a loved one, especially a child.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Time to wake up, sunshine, breakfast is ready!
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 是时候起床了，宝贝，早餐准备好了！
